job.title: CNC / LTCC Technician (2nd/3rd shift) - Temp-to-Hire
job.description:
If you are a CNC Operator, LTCC Technician, or have experience with screen printing, punching tape, or electrical testing, please read on!
Working here gives you the opportunity to work with cutting edge technology, have a direct influence on next generation products hitting the market and drive the overall growth and development of the semiconductor industry. We are a fast-paced, agile, growing company that values diversity of thought and constantly strives for a more diverse, inclusive environment. We are looking for enthusiastic, talented individuals who can thrive in a changing and challenging environment.
What You Will Be Doing
The Low Temperature Cofired Ceramic (LTCC) technology can be defined as a way to produce multilayer circuits with the help of single tapes, which are used to apply conductive, dielectric and/or resistive pastes on. These single sheets have to be laminated together and fired in one step all.
Inspection of LTCC punched and printed sheets
Determine the final product requirements based on job specifications, including appearance and measurement.
Ensure that all of the quality check procedures put in place by the company are followed during every production phase.
Ability to commit to flexible schedule and prompt arrival for shifts.
What You Need for this Position
High school diploma/GED required
3+ years experience in LTCC or similar training: punching tape, screen printing, electrical testing, microscope inspection and automatic inspection machines
Hands on experience inspecting LTCC punched and printed sheets is a plus
Experience on puncher machine, fill printer, laminator and/or Microcraft Tester
Familiar with metrology tools, such as Mitutoyo or Sigmatech
Experience using Microsoft Excel
PCB fabrication and testing experience would be a plus
Strong verbal and written communication, such as to inform supervisors of any part or equipment defects to ensure prompt response to the problem
Team player with strong attention to detail
WILL PROVIDE TRAINING
Must be willing to work weekends! Shifts available:
2nd Shift : 2pm-10:30pm
3rd Shift: 10pm - 6:30am
What's In It for You
Hourly Rate: $25 - $30/hour depending on experience
Temp-to-Hire position (possibility of full-time conversion after 6 months)
Medical, Dental, Vision and 401k benefits available
COVID-19: We are committed to the safety of our employees. We have ample safety protocols in place, including social distancing, safety training and appropriate screenings for all on-site personnel and visitors.
______
If you feel you are a good fit for this position, please apply here or email your resume to meghan.medrick@cybercoders.com
Email Your Resume In Word To
Looking forward to receiving your resume through our website and going over the position with you. Clicking apply is the best way to apply, but you may also:
Meghan.Medrick@CyberCoders.com
Please do NOT change the email subject line in any way. You must keep the JobID: linkedin : MM12-1627888 -- in the email subject line for your application to be considered.***
Meghan Medrick - Lead Recruiter - CyberCoders
Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.
CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Your Right to Work
- In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.
CyberCoders will consider for Employment in the City of Los Angeles qualified Applicants with Criminal Histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring (Ban the Box) Ordinance.
